definition: a general state or ordering of things, a system of revealed (see reveal entry 1 sense 1) commands and promises regulating human affairs
examples: a privilege maintained under the new dispensation

definition: a particular arrangement or provision especially of providence or nature
examples: involving special dispensation by the Church

definition: an exemption from a law or from an impediment, vow, or oath
examples: may be granted a dispensation from the rule
requested a dispensation to form another lodge
… one of the most remarkable cultural dispensations in the country's history, the paperback book.
